alert.name: ICMP packet loss from usopmon01 to uSOP boards alert

panels.title: ICMP packet loss from usopmon01 to uSOP boards

panels.content:
Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) defines a special packet which always triggers a reply from the node has received it. 
A response indicates that the target host is connected to the network, is reachable from the query agent, and 
is in a sufficiently functional state to access the network. Packet loss is evaluated every 5 minutes, after sending 30 ICMP packets
(1 every 10s). The formula used is:

        packet_loss = ((pkt_sent - pkt_recv) / pkt_sent) * 100

An alert is issued if packet_loss >= 50%
